00027 struct variable_zerodata_t: public data_t {
00028     public:
00029     variable_zerodata_t() { copies=1; fixed_mask=0; length=max_length=1;
00030         *magnitude=0; }
00031 };
00032 
00033 variable_zerodata_t* variable_zerodata() {
00034     static std::auto_ptr<variable_zerodata_t> z(new variable_zerodata_t);
00035     return z.get();

00040 base_integer::base_integer(): flags(0), data(0) { }

00042 base_integer::base_integer(const base_integer& c, bool fixed): flags(0), data(0)
00043 {
00044     if (fixed) flags |= flag_fixedlength;
00045     _attach(c);

00048 base_integer::base_integer(size_t count, digit_t mask): flags(flag_fixedlength),
00049     data(0)
00050 {
00051     _base_attach(allocate_fixed(mask, count, 1));
00052 }

00054 base_integer::base_integer(data_t *adopt, bool neg): flags(0), data(0) {
00055     if (adopt && adopt->fixed_mask != 0) flags |= flag_fixedlength;
00056     _base_attach(adopt);
00057     _set_negative(neg);
00058 }

00060 base_integer::~base_integer() {
00061     if (data && --data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00062 }

00064 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index) const {
00065     return data->magnitude[index];
00066 }

00068 digit_t base_integer::_get_digit(size_t index, bool) const {
00069     if (index >= data->length) return 0;
00070     return data->magnitude[index];

00075     return data->magnitude;

00086 size_t base_integer::_get_max_length() const {
00087     return _is_fixed() ? _fixed_digits() : (std::numeric_limits<size_t>::max)();

00091     data->length = digits;

00094 size_t base_integer::_log2() const {
00095     size_t len = _get_length() - 1;
00096     return (bits_per_digit * len) + log2(_get_digit(len));
00097 }

00099 void base_integer::_set_unsigned(boost::uintmax_t n, bool negative) {
00100     // Assumes that the proper allocation & sizing was already done
00101     assert(!_get_readonly());
00102     if (data == 0) _base_attach(allocate(detail::digits_in_uintmax));
00103     if (digit_t(n) == n) {
00104         data->length = 1;
00105         *data->magnitude = digit_t(n);
00106     } else {
00107         digit_t *i = data->magnitude, *ie = i + data->max_length;
00108         while (n != 0 && i != ie) {
00109             *i++ = digit_t(n & digit_mask);
00110             n >>= bits_per_digit;
00111         }
00112         data->length = i - data->magnitude;
00113     }
00114     _set_negative(negative);
00115     _cleanup();
00116 }
00117 
00118 void base_integer::_set_signed(boost::intmax_t n) {
00119     if (n >= 0) {
00120         _set_unsigned(n);
00121     } else if (n == (std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::min)()) {
00122         // Have to treat the minimum number carefully, because -n is not
00123         // what you'd think it is.
00124         _set_unsigned(-(n+1), true);
00125         _decrement();
00126     } else {
00127         _set_unsigned(-n, true);
00128     }
00129 }

00131 bool base_integer::_is_unique() const {
00132     return (!data || data->copies <= 1);
00133 }
00134 
00135 bool base_integer::_is_zero() const {
00136     return (data->length == 1 && *data->magnitude == 0);
00137 }
00138 
00139 bool base_integer::_is_fixed() const {
00140     if (data) return (data->fixed_mask != 0);
00141     else return ((flags & flag_fixedlength) != 0);
00142 }
00143 
00144 size_t base_integer::_fixed_digits() const {
00145     return _is_fixed() ? data->max_length : 0;
00146 }
00147 
00148 size_t base_integer::_fixed_bits() const {
00149     size_t digits = _fixed_digits();
00150     if (digits != 0) return ((digits - 1) * detail::bits_per_digit) +
00151             detail::log2(data->fixed_mask);
00152     else return 0;
00153 }

00156     return ((flags & flag_negative) ? true : false);
00157 }

00159 void base_integer::_set_negative(bool neg) {
00160     if (neg) flags |= flag_negative;
00161     else flags &= ~flag_negative;

00164 void base_integer::_toggle_negative() {
00165     flags ^= flag_negative;

00173     flags |= flag_readonly;

00176 void base_integer::_realloc(size_t new_digit_count) {
00177     data = reallocate(data, new_digit_count);

00180 void base_integer::_make_unique() {
00181     if (data && !_is_unique()) {
00182         data_t *olddata = data;
00183 
00184         data = (olddata->fixed_mask != 0 ?
00185             allocate_fixed(olddata->fixed_mask, olddata->max_length, 0) :
00186             allocate(olddata->length, 0));
00187         data->copies = 1;
00188         data->length = olddata->length;
00189 
00190         digit_t *s = olddata->magnitude, *se = s + olddata->length;
00191         digit_t *t = data->magnitude;
00192         while (s != se) *t++ = *s++;
00193 
00194         --olddata->copies;
00195     }
00196 }

00198 void base_integer::_swap(base_integer& other) {
00199     flag_t tempflags = flags;
00200     flags = other.flags;
00201     other.flags = tempflags;
00202 
00203     data_t *tempdata = data;
00204     data = other.data;
00205     other.data = tempdata;
00206 }
00207 
00208 void base_integer::_base_attach(data_t *new_data, flag_t setflags, size_t
00209     extra_allocation)
00210 {
00211     #ifdef BOOST_XINT_USE_COPY_ON_WRITE
00212         bool adopt=true;
00213     #else
00214         bool adopt=(new_data && new_data->copies == 0);
00215     #endif
00216 
00217     if (data != new_data || extra_allocation != 0) {
00218         // If only one of them is fixed-length, the data can't be adopted.
00219         if (adopt && new_data && _is_fixed() != (new_data->fixed_mask != 0))
00220             adopt=false;
00221 
00222         // If either of them are fixed-length, and they're not the same fixed-
00223         // length, then the data can't be adopted.
00224         if (adopt && data && new_data && (data->fixed_mask ||
00225             new_data->fixed_mask) && (data->fixed_mask != new_data->fixed_mask
00226             || data->max_length != new_data->max_length)) adopt=false;
00227 
00228         // If we don't have a data item, but we're supposed to allocate extra
00229         // data, we can't adopt the existing data item.
00230         if (adopt && extra_allocation != 0 && !data) adopt=false;
00231 
00232         // If extra_allocation is requested, and it's a variable-length integer,
00233         // check the max_size. If there isn't enough to fit in the
00234         // extra_allocation, don't allow adoption.
00235         if (adopt && extra_allocation != 0 && data->fixed_mask == 0)
00236             if (data->length + extra_allocation > data->max_length) adopt=false;
00237 
00238         if (adopt) {
00239             if (data && --data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00240             data=new_data;
00241             if (data) ++data->copies;
00242         } else if (new_data != 0) {
00243             // Duplicate the data in a unique data_t item
00244             if (data == 0) {
00245                 data = (_is_fixed() ?
00246                     allocate_fixed(new_data->fixed_mask, new_data->max_length,
00247                         0) :
00248                     allocate(new_data->length + extra_allocation, 0));
00249                 ++data->copies;
00250             } else if ((data->copies > 1 || data->max_length < new_data->length
00251                 + extra_allocation) || _get_readonly())
00252             {
00253                 data_t *olddata = data;
00254                 data = (_is_fixed() ?
00255                     allocate_fixed(data->fixed_mask, data->max_length, 0) :
00256                     allocate(new_data->length + extra_allocation, 0));
00257                 ++data->copies;
00258                 if (--olddata->copies == 0) deallocate(olddata);
00259             }
00260             data->length = (std::min)(new_data->length + extra_allocation,
00261                 data->max_length);
00262 
00263             digit_t *s = new_data->magnitude, *se = s + new_data->length;
00264             digit_t *t = data->magnitude, *te = t + data->length;
00265             while (t != te && s != se) *t++ = *s++;
00266             zero(t, te);
00267         } else {
00268             if (--data->copies == 0) deallocate(data);
00269             data=0;
00270         }
00271     }
00272     flags = setflags;
00273 }
00274 
00275 void base_integer::_attach(const base_integer& copy) {
00276     _base_attach(copy.data, copy.flags);
00277     if (data) _cleanup();
00278 }
00279 
00280 void base_integer::_cleanup() {
00281     digit_t *p = data->magnitude + data->length - 1;
00282     if (data->fixed_mask != 0 && p == data->magnitude + data->max_length - 1)
00283         *p &= data->fixed_mask;
00284     if (*p == 0) {
00285         if (p != data->magnitude) {
00286             while (--p != data->magnitude && *p == 0); // Null loop
00287             if (*p == 0) _set_negative(false); // It's zero.
00288             data->length = p - data->magnitude + 1;
00289         } // It's zero, but it may legitimately be a "negative zero", leave it.
00290     }
00291 }
00292 
00293 integer base_integer::_to_integer() const {
00294     integer r;
00295     r._attach(*this);
00296     return r;
00297 }
00298 
00299 void base_integer::_increment(bool absolute_value) {
00300     _make_unique();
00301     if (_is_zero()) {
00302         data->magnitude[0] = 1;
00303         _set_negative(false);
00304     } else if (!absolute_value && _get_negative()) {
00305         _decrement(true);
00306     } else {
00307         _realloc(_get_length() + 1);
00308         digit_t *p = _get_writable_digits(), *pe = p + _get_length();
00309 
00310         while (p < pe) {
00311             if (*p == digit_mask) *p++ = 0;
00312             else { *p++ += 1; break; }
00313         }
00314         _cleanup();
00315     }
00316 }
00317 
00318 void base_integer::_decrement(bool absolute_value) {
00319     _make_unique();
00320     if (_is_zero()) {
00321         data->magnitude[0]=1;
00322         _set_negative(true);
00323     } else if (!absolute_value && _get_negative()) {
00324         _increment(true);
00325     } else {
00326         digit_t *p = _get_writable_digits(), *pe = p + _get_length();
00327         while (p != pe) {
00328             if (*p == 0) *p++ = digit_mask;
00329             else { *p++ -= 1; break; }
00330         }
00331         _cleanup();
00332     }
00333 }

00337 void base_variable_length_integer::_attach_0() {
00338     _base_attach(variable_zerodata());
00339 }
00340 
00341 size_t log10_bits(size_t bits) {
00342     assert(std::numeric_limits<boost::intmax_t>::digits >= 32);
00343     const boost::intmax_t large_step(1000000000), small_step(10);
00344     const size_t count_per_large_step = 9, count_per_small_step = 1;
00345     integer n(pow2(bits)-1);
00346 
00347     size_t r = 0;
00348     while (n >= large_step) { n /= large_step; r += count_per_large_step; }
00349     while (n >= small_step) { n /= small_step; r += count_per_small_step; }
00350     return r;
00351 }
